text: Yes, I personally previously built one, it’s definitely possible and not a bad experience. You have two routes you could go, feed all the data in for your products that you are comparing ahead of displaying them using HubL or use the HubDB JS client to query the data for each product you are comparing.

Is there a way to reference the contents of a file/partial inside of HubDB? For example, I’m working on a style guide similar to <https://canvas.HubSpot.com/components>. Currently, I have a cell for html that is copied and pasted from a file in HubSpot, it would be helpful if I could keep the contents of that file and the related cell in sync.
I faced the same when filtering with values with spaces.
I used a hhubl string function to remove spaces
